metadata.title: CVE-2023-3159 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A use after free issue was discovered in driver/firewire inoutbound_phy_packet_callback in the Linux Kernel. In this flaw a localattacker with special privilege may cause a use after free problem whenqueue_event() fails.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-193-generic - 3.13.0-193.244
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-193-lowlatency - 3.13.0-193.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-193.244').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
